rustdesk.title: Install RustDesk
rustdesk.intro: RustDesk is a remote desktop app used for support and access across devices.
rustdesk.alert: You may see a warning that says "You are being scammed" on the RustDesk website. We will only access your computer with your permission to install RustDesk, and you can delete it afterward and change your password. Our goal is to be professional and do a great job.

sources.title: Download from official sources
sources.body: Use the official RustDesk site or GitHub releases to avoid fake installers.

windows.title: Windows (10/11)
steps: Download the Windows installer (.exe or .msi) from GitHub releases.
Open the file and follow the installer prompts.
Launch RustDesk and allow firewall access if prompted.
Share your ID and one-time password with the person helping you.

macos.title: macOS
steps: Download the macOS .dmg from GitHub releases.
Open the .dmg and drag RustDesk into Applications.
If macOS blocks it, go to System Settings > Privacy & Security and allow it to open.
Grant Accessibility, Screen Recording, and Input Monitoring permissions when prompted.

linux.title: Linux
steps: Download the package for your distro (.deb, .rpm, or AppImage) from GitHub releases.
Install it using your software center or package manager.
Launch RustDesk from your applications menu.
Allow any requested permissions for screen control.

android.title: Android
steps: Download the Android APK from GitHub releases.
Open the APK and allow installation from this source if prompted.
Open RustDesk and note your ID and password.

ios.title: iPhone / iPad
steps: Install the app and open it.
You can control other devices from iOS, but iOS devices cannot be controlled.

safety.title: First connection and safety
steps: Only share your RustDesk ID and one-time password with people you trust.
If you did not request help, close the app and do not share your code.
End the session when support is finished.
safety.note: RustDesk shows a new password each time it starts. This helps prevent unwanted access.

docker.title: Install Docker Desktop
docker.intro: Docker Desktop lets you run containers on Windows and macOS with a simple desktop app.

sources.title: Download from official sources
sources.body: Use Docker's official download page and documentation to avoid fake installers.

windows.title: Windows (10/11)
steps: Download the Windows installer from the official page.
Run the installer and keep the WSL 2 option enabled if prompted.
Restart your PC if the installer asks.
Open Docker Desktop and wait for the engine to show as running.

macos.title: macOS
steps: Download the correct installer for your Mac (Apple Silicon or Intel).
Open the .dmg and drag Docker Desktop into Applications.
Open Docker Desktop and approve the permissions when prompted.
Wait for the engine status to show as running.

verify.title: Verify the install (optional)
steps: Open Terminal (macOS) or PowerShell (Windows).
Run: docker --version
Run: docker run hello-world
verify.note: If you see a success message, Docker Desktop is ready to use.

linux.title: Linux note
linux.body: Docker Desktop is for Windows and macOS. On Linux, install Docker Engine using your distro's package manager.
